page.title: 07Tavistock Livestock Market
page.content: The Livestock Market was established at its present site in the middle of the 19th century.The original open air market was held in Market Street. Livestock and fatstock markets for the sale of{cattle and sheep}are held on Fridays and the second Wednesday in the month. Special annual sales are held, including{Goose Fair}when geese are auctioned. Ward and Chowen,the local estate agents and auctioneers, are the organisers and advertisers of the market. Officials from the{R.S.P.C.A.} and an Animal Health Inspector are always present to make sure the animals are healthy,tagged and well treated. Farmers travel from the surrounding area of Tavistock in order to buy,sell or to find out the best prices of the animals.{Our livestock {market is busy,noisy but interesting.}
